lessons.title: What a Fuel System Does
lessons.text: A fuel system has one main job: supply an engine with fuel. It also helps get the fuel ready so it can burn the right way inside the engine.
lessons.analogy: Think of it like a wood stove setup: you need a steady supply of good fuel, delivered smoothly, so the fire burns the way you want.

quiz.question: What is the main job of the fuel system?
options: To supply the engine with fuel
quiz.feedback: Correct. The fuel system’s main job is to supply fuel to the engine.

lessons.title: Fuel Tank
lessons.text: The fuel tank stores gasoline (or diesel) so the car can run for many miles. The tank must be strong and sealed so fuel does not leak.
lessons.analogy: It’s like a sealed jerry can built into the vehicle.

quiz.question: What does the fuel tank do?
quiz.feedback: Yes. The fuel tank stores fuel safely.

lessons.title: Fuel Pump
lessons.text: The fuel pump moves fuel from the tank toward the engine. Many cars use an electric fuel pump to push fuel forward under pressure.
lessons.analogy: Like a small pump that moves water through a hose—except it’s fuel.

quiz.question: What is the fuel pump’s job?
quiz.feedback: Correct. The fuel pump moves fuel from the tank to the engine area.

lessons.title: Fuel Filter
lessons.text: A fuel filter removes dirt and particles from fuel before it reaches the engine. Clean fuel helps parts last longer and helps the engine run smoother.
lessons.analogy: Like a water filter that stops grit from getting into a pump.

quiz.question: Why do we need a fuel filter?
options: To create heat in the engine
quiz.feedback: Right. It removes dirt and particles before fuel reaches the engine.

lessons.title: Mixing Fuel With Air
lessons.text: Engines do not burn liquid fuel well by itself. Fuel must mix with air in the right amount. Older systems used a carburetor. Many newer systems use fuel injection.
lessons.analogy: Like starting a campfire: you need fuel and air together, not one without the other.

quiz.question: What must fuel mix with to burn properly?
quiz.feedback: Correct. Fuel must mix with air to burn properly.

lessons.title: Fuel System Review
lessons.text: Say these parts out loud in order and explain each in one sentence: fuel tank, fuel pump, fuel filter, mixing with air. If you can say it, you know it.
lessons.analogy: This is your quick ‘say-it-back’ check before moving on.
